## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**AI Assistant:**
Hey there! I'm here to assist you with any questions you might have about Verus. What's on your mind today?

**User:**
I downloaded the Verus CLI, and I noticed that there's a txt file included with it. What's the purpose of that file, and how can I use it to verify my download?

**AI Assistant:**
The txt file included with each download contains the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature. To verify the download, you can extract the archive, verify the signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file, and then extract the archive to the desired directory. This ensures that your download hasn't been tampered with and is the official release from the Verus team. Do you have any other questions about verifying your download?

**User:**
No, that makes sense. I've also heard about the Verus DeFi Testnet. What's that all about?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is currently testing new features and protocols before they are released on the mainnet. The testnet has 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, and is available worldwide. It's a platform for testing and hardening new Verus protocols, and all currencies and assets on the testnet have no value and may be reset at any time. It's a great way to get a sneak peek at what's coming to Verus and to help the community test and refine new features.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. How can I get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies to try out the new protocols?

**AI Assistant:**
You can get a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies by visiting the Verus Discord and asking in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf. The community will be happy to help you get set up with some testnet currencies to experiment with.

**User:**
One last question. How can I verify a file directly using the CLI?

**AI Assistant:**
You can verify a file directly using the CLI with the `verifyfile` command. The format of the command is:
```
./verus verifyfile "signer_identity" "signature" "/path/to/file"
```
For example:
```
./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AbRHFQABQSBEyhS6Ohi6c4XfZfcM2xvlBkdH3CVtRMBiKgVaX6Z1SShf7c27DiBGveW60y0UQ455O5oZedXxvBybddEWIFi/ /Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.2-8-x86_64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.2-8-x86_64.tar.gz
```
This will verify the signature of the file against the provided signer identity and signature. Do you have any other questions about using the `verifyfile` command?
What is the purpose of the txt file included with each download, and how can I verify the download using this file?

The txt file included with each download contains the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature. To verify the download, you can extract the archive, verify the signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file, and then extract the archive to the desired directory.

## Verifying Downloads A txt file containing the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature, is included for each download. These packages have been signed with the identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@". 1) Extract downloaded archive 2) Verify signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file. 3) Extract archive to desired directory ### CLI examples **Verifying file directly** ``` ./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AbRHFQABQSBEyhS6Ohi6c4XfZfcM2xvlBkdH3CVtRMBiKgVaX6Z1SShf7c27DiBGveW60y0UQ455O5oZedXxvBybddEWIFi/ /Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.2-8-x86_64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.2-8-x86_64.tar.gz ``` **Verifying using a checksum** ``` ./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AbRHFQABQSBEyhS6Ohi6c4XfZfcM2xvlBkdH3CVtRMBiKgVaX6Z1SShf7c27DiBGveW60y0UQ455O5oZedXxvBybddEWIFi/ 727f6f7e2055adffde5928e17a50ffb99ec5ba45e8bc6cc543cbcdd7d6cbd15a ```**The result will be true if the signature is valid.** ``` true ``` Announcing NON-MANDATORY CLI upgrade v0.7.2-7, with fixes necessary to continue participating in the current testnet. Mainnet features are effectively unchanged from v0.7.2-6.## The Verus DeFi Testnet -- THERE IS NO TESTNET RESET All new 'sendcurrency' features described above now work on both mainnet and testnet. In addition, testnet can source funds for DeFi features from private z-addresses as well.This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever released, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf
What is the Verus DeFi Testnet, and what are its features?

The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that is currently testing new features and protocols before they are released on the mainnet. The testnet has 50% proof of work and 50% proof of stake, and is available worldwide. It is a platform for testing and hardening new Verus protocols, and all currencies and assets on the testnet have no value and may be reset at any time.
